title: Hollywood’s Enduring Fascination with Ancient Rome
subtitle: The allure of ancient Rome remains irresistible for filmmakers, offering a potent blend of grandeur, intrigue, and decadence. With its capricious rulers, dramatic politics, and penchant for bloodsport, Rome provides a narrative canvas rich in historical significance and sensationalist potential. For Hollywood, this setting serves as both an educational backdrop and an excuse to push the boundaries of storytelling, blending scholarship with spectacle to captivate audiences across generations.
author: 侯 默

title: “美国优先”的世界：特朗普回归可能对全球秩序的深远影响
subtitle: 如果美国不再视自身为全球秩序的核心塑造者，而是逐渐回归普通大国的角色，世界将会如何变化？这一假设并非全然虚构，而是基于一种可能性：美国外交政策彻底放弃多边主义和全球责任转而关注短期的国家利益最大化。
author: DailyPolitics

title: Book Review: Mimura's Planning for Empire
subtitle: Mimura opens a nuanced debate about the ideological motivations behind Japan’s expansionist policies, especially in the context of the global spread of technocratic ideas during the early twentieth century.
author: 侯 默

title: Is there such a thing as too much democracy?
subtitle: At a rally in Michigan, Donald Trump proclaimed to his supporters that, as a true man of the people, if he were to lose the 2024 presidential election, then American democracy would be dead.
author: Qinhe

title: US Elections Prediction
subtitle: While I do have my political views on this election, this article aims to remain nonpartisan. It focuses on predicting the election one day ahead, using recent insights that may be less widely known.
author: 侯 默

title: On Right-Wing Propaganda
subtitle: From the earliest forms, far-right movements utilized propaganda to spread their ideals, whether in power or not. These propagandas can be positive, presenting the far-right movement as benign and helping the nation, or negative, vilifying opponents of the movement. As technology progressed, propaganda had also taken various forms. This essay examines the key forms of propaganda the far-right used and its purposes by evaluating the use of propaganda by right-wing movements in three drastically different contexts- late 19th century France, imperial Japan, and Fascist Italy.
author: 侯 默

title: Why do civilisations collapse? Is our civilisation in danger?
subtitle: Scholars have proposed myriad reasons for the collapse of civilisations, such as environmental deterioration (Diamond, 2005) and a lack of social welfare (Good and Reuveny, 2009). However, most agree that human actions, particularly governmental failures, play a role. As this essay will argue, a collapse of governance can be largely attributed to insufficient democratisation of governing systems, a problem which inevitably leads to internal government malfunctions.
author: Qinhe
